description:
A QuestionableTagRenderingConfigJson is a single piece of code which converts one ore more tags into a HTML-snippet.
If the desired tags are missing and a question is defined, a question will be shown instead.

hints.question: What are common options?

description: Allows fixed-tag inputs, shown either as radiobuttons or as checkboxes

hints.question: What tags should be matched to show this option?

description: If in 'question'-mode and the contributor selects this option, these tags will be applied to the object

hints.question: What corresponding text should be shown?

description: Shown if the `if` is fulfilled

hints.question: What icon should be shown next to this mapping?

path.description:
The path to the  icon
Type: icon

description: This icon will only be shown if the value is known, it is not displayed in the options (but might be in the future)
The path to the  icon
Size of the image

hints.question: Under what circumstances should this mapping be hidden from the possibilities a contributor can pick?
hints.iftrue: Never show this mapping as option to pick
hints.ifunset: Always show this mapping as option to pick

hints.ifunset: No other cases when this text is shown

description: Also show this 'then'-option if the feature matches these tags. Ideal for outdated tags or default assumptions. The tags from this options will not be set if the option is chosen!

hints.question: What tags should be applied if this mapping is _not_ chosen?
hints.ifunset: Do not apply a tag if a different mapping is chosen.

description:
Only applicable if 'multiAnswer' is set.
This is for situations such as:
`accepts:coins=no` where one can select all the possible payment methods. However, we want to make explicit that some options _were not_ selected.
This can be done with `ifnot`
Note that we can not explicitly render this negative case to the user, we cannot show `does _not_ accept coins`.
If this is important to your usecase, consider using multiple radiobutton-fields without `multiAnswer`

The main representation of Tags.
See https://github.com/pietervdvn/MapComplete/blob/develop/Docs/Tags_format.md for more documentation

The main representation of Tags.
See https://github.com/pietervdvn/MapComplete/blob/develop/Docs/Tags_format.md for more documentation

hints.question: What extra tags should be added to the object if this object is chosen?

description:
If chosen as answer, these tags will be applied onto the object, together with the tags from the `if`
Not compatible with multiAnswer.
This can be used e.g. to erase other keys which indicate the 'not' value:
```json
{
    "if": "crossing:marking=rainbow",
    "then": "This is a rainbow crossing",
    "addExtraTags": ["not:crossing:marking="]
}
```

hints.question: If there are many options, what search terms match too?

description:
If there are many options, the mappings-radiobuttons will be replaced by an element with a searchfunction
Searchterms (per language) allow to easily find an option if there are many options

If the searchable selector is picked, mappings with this item will have priority and show up even if the others are hidden
Use this sparingly

The main representation of Tags.

Used for comments or to disable a validation
ignore-image-in-then: normally, a `then`-clause is not allowed to have an `img`-html-element as icons are preferred. In some cases (most notably title-icons), this is allowed

hints.question: Should a contributor be allowed to select multiple mappings?
hints.iffalse: only allow to select a single mapping
hints.ifunset: only allow to select a single mapping

description: If true, use checkboxes instead of radio buttons when asking the question
Allow freeform text input from the user

hints.question: What is the name of the attribute that should be written to?
hints.ifunset: do not offer a freeform textfield as answer option

description: This is the OpenStreetMap-key that that value will be written to

hints.question: What is the input type?

suggestions.then: string A simple piece of text
text A longer piece of text. Uses an textArea instead of a textField
date A date with date picker
nat A whole, positive number or zero
int A whole number, either positive, negative or zero

distance A geographical distance in meters (rounded at two points). Will give an extra minimap with a measurement tool. Arguments: [ zoomlevel, preferredBackgroundMapType (comma separated) ], e.g. `["21", "map,photo"]
direction A geographical direction, in degrees. 0° is north, 90° is east, ... Will return a value between 0 (incl) and 360 (excl).
wikidata A wikidata identifier, e.g. Q42.
pnat A strict positive number
float A decimal number
pfloat A positive decimal number or zero
email An email adress

url The validatedTextField will format URLs to always be valid and have a https://-header (even though the 'https'-part will be hidden from the user. Furthermore, some tracking parameters will be removed
phone A phone number
opening_hours Has extra elements to easily input when a POI is opened.
color Shows a color picker
icon Makes sure that a valid .svg-path is added
fediverse Validates fediverse addresses and normalizes them into `@username@server`-format
id Checks for valid identifiers for layers, will automatically replace spaces and uppercase

slope Validates that the slope is a valid number.The accompanying input element uses the gyroscope and the compass to determine the correct incline. The sign of the incline will be set automatically. The bearing of the way is compared to the bearing of the compass, as such, the device knows if it is measuring in the forward or backward direction.
velopark A special URL-validator that checks the domain name and rewrites to the correct velopark format.
currency Validates monetary amounts

description:
The type of the text-field, e.g. 'string', 'nat', 'float', 'date',...
See Docs/SpecialInputElements.md and UI/Input/ValidatedTextField.ts for supported values

hints.question: What placeholder text should be shown in the input-element if there is no input?
hints.ifunset: No specific placeholder is set, show the type of the textfield

description: A (translated) text that is shown (as gray text) within the textfield

Extra parameters to initialize the input helper arguments.
For semantics, see the 'SpecialInputElements.md'

If a value is added with the textfield, these extra tag is addded.
Useful to add a 'fixme=freeform textfield used - to be checked'

hints.question: Show the freeform as box within the question?
hints.iftrue: show the freeform input field as a small field within the question
hints.ifunset: show the freeform input field full-width

description:
Instead of showing a full-width text field, the text field will be shown within the rendering of the question.
This combines badly with special input elements, as it'll distort the layout.

hints.question: What value should be entered in the text field if no value is set?

description: This can help people to quickly enter the most common option

hints.question: What values of the freeform key should be interpreted as 'unknown'?
hints.ifunset: The question will be considered answered if any value is set for the key

description: For example, if a feature has `shop=yes`, the question 'what type of shop is this?' should still asked

hints.question: What question should be shown to the contributor?
hints.ifunset: This tagrendering will be shown if it is known, but cannot be edited by the contributor, effectively resutling in a read-only rendering

description: A question is presented ot the user if no mapping matches and the 'freeform' key is not set as well.

hints.question: Should some extra information be shown to the contributor, alongside the question?

description:
This hint is shown in subtle text under the question.
This can give some extra information on what the answer should ook like

When using a screenreader and selecting the 'edit' button, the current rendered value is read aloud in normal circumstances.
In some rare cases, this is not desirable. For example, if the rendered value is a link to a website, this link can be selected (and will be read aloud).
If the user presses _tab_ again, they'll select the button and have the link read aloud a second time.
A list of labels. These are strings that are used for various purposes, e.g. to only include a subset of the tagRenderings when reusing a layer

hints.question: What text should be rendered?
hints.ifunset: No text is shown if no predefined options match.

description:
This piece of text will be shown in the infobox.
In this text, values within braces (such as {braced(key)}) are replaced by the corresponding `value` in the object.
For example, if the object contains tags `amenity=school; name=Windy Hill School`, the render string `This school is named {name}` will be shown to the user as `This school is named Windy Hill School`
This text will be shown if:
- there is no mapping which matches (or there are no matches)
- no question, no mappings and no 'freeform' is set
Note that this is a HTML-interpreted value, so you can add links as e.g. '<a href='{website}'>{website}</a>' or include images such as `This is of type A <br><img src='typeA-icon.svg' />`

hints.question: what icon should be shown next to the 'render' value?
hints.ifunset: No additional icon is shown next to the always shown text

path.description:
The path to the icon
Type: icon

class.description:
A hint to mapcomplete on how to render this icon within the mapping.
This is translated to 'mapping-icon-<classtype>', so defining your own in combination with a custom CSS is possible (but discouraged)

description:
An icon shown next to the rendering; typically shown pretty small
This is only shown next to the "render" value
The path to the icon

A hint to mapcomplete on how to render this icon within the mapping.
This is translated to 'mapping-icon-<classtype>', so defining your own in combination with a custom CSS is possible (but discouraged)

hints.ifunset: No specific condition set; always show this tagRendering or show this question if unknown

hints.question: When should this item be shown (including special conditions)?
hints.ifunset: No specific metacondition set which is evaluated against the usersettings/application state; always show this tagRendering or show this question if unknown

description:
If set, this tag will be evaluated against the _usersettings/application state_ table.
Enable 'show debug info' in user settings to see available options (at the settings-tab).
Note that values with an underscore depicts _application state_ (including metainfo about the user) whereas values without an underscore depict _user settings_

A human-readable text explaining what this tagRendering does.
Mostly used for the shared tagrenderings

hints.question: What css-classes should be applied to showing this attribute?

description:
A list of css-classes to apply to the entire tagRendering.
These classes are applied in 'answer'-mode, not in question mode
This is only for advanced users.
Values are split on ` `  (space)
